title: Staff Developer Advocate, Developer Relations
content:
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
Who we are
As the Developer Evangelist on the Developer Relations team, you'll develop and own the narrative to inspire Stripe’s developer users in how our products help to solve their problems, and build confidence across all key decision makers that the solutions chosen with Stripe will deliver for their needs now and in the future. You’ll build confidence in new and existing users around their understanding of their selected product integrations with Stripe and speed their understanding to make integration decisions. You will own the development of demos, examples and talks that you and senior executives use at our major events. 
 
You will:

Represent the overall Stripe brand to the Developer persona to all of our external users, partnering with teams across the company to demonstrate the capabilities and implementation of our suite of products
Develop and own the developer narrative internally and externally on how our products help to solve developer’s problems
Create momentum and drive adoption of the platform through your interactions with developers building applications and businesses on Stripe
Champion Stripe's developer products in person and online by presenting at conferences, events and meetups
Build inspiring demos, sample apps that demonstrate the functionality of Stripe’s products for both technical and non-technical audiences
Coach and support Stripe executives on the delivery of compelling technical demos and presentations at events or internally 

 
We're looking for someone who has:

15+ years of experience in a Developer Relations, Software Engineering, or related
Creative, empathetic, communicative, and clever
Confident and comfortable presenting to different types of audiences, large and small
Adept skills communicating technically complicated topics simply and elegantly
Strong hands-on developer who is comfortable with full-stack development
Built full-scale demos of products that demonstrate their capabilities and inspire your users
Intellectually curious, with great problem-solving skills

 
You should include these in your application:

Projects & code you're proud of
Products you've worked on
Links to your blog or your profile in online communities like GitHub, Twitter, YouTube, Quora, or Stack Overflow
Languages you are fluent in, both human and technical
What you find most interesting about Stripe

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
